p: Plants have been the major source of anticancer drugs both in orthodox and traditional medicine. The World Health Organization (WHO) estimated that approximately 60% of the world's inhabitants (and 80% of Africa's population) depends on herbal medicine for their primary health care [ 4]. The plants are the sources of antineoplastic drugs, vinblastine, and vincristine isolated from Catharanthus roseus, paclitaxel from Taxus brevifol, and camptothecin from Camptotheca acuminata which also lead to production of semisynthetic compounds, topotecan and irinotecan [ 5, 6].
